Know your skin

Services we offer

scroll to discover

expertise our ethos

‘Ageing is a fact of life. Looking your age is not’

sk:INSPIRE is proud to deliver a wide range of bespoke non-surgical procedures and skincare, making each journey memorable.

Video Consultations

In response to COVID-19, we have introduced video consultations for patients who require initial treatment or skincare consultations, in addition to treatment reviews (where suitable).

Our specialist team is on hand to go through your concerns, discuss treatment options and skincare products.

To book your consultation or review, simply  call or email us and we will be more than happy to find you a suitable date and time.

anti-wrinkle injections

As we age, we start to notice wrinkle lines in our face, even when we are not making any facial expressions. These are caused by the repeated use of the facial muscles in a particular manner.

For example, just as a freshly ironed shirt will become severely creased at the elbow as a result of bending the arm, in a similar way, our facial lines form whenever we frown, squint or smile. This is the most common sign of ageing that patient’s endeavour to get treated.

Treatment involves temporarily relaxing the underlying muscles in specific areas using botulinum toxin, resulting in smoother lines and a more youthful appearance to the skin.

Our ethos is to use a ‘less is more’ approach to ensure that we enhance your natural beauty.

view prices faqs
dermal fillers

As we age, we start to lose bone mass, tissue, fat, elastin, collagen and hyaluronic acid from our faces resulting in skin sagging, dehydration and loss of volume. One of the most common and key areas that are affected are the cheeks and lower face. As the skin begins to sag, the face can change shape and jowls can appear. The lines from the nose to the mouth look deeper-set and create an overall heavy appearance.

We aim to soften the signs of ageing and restore the appearance of plump, hydrated, healthy looking skin with the help of dermal fillers. This non-surgical treatment makes use of a sugar-based, non-permanent transparent gel which is injected for facial rejuvenation and revitalising the skin. Dermal fillers are used to fill superficial skin depressions and fine lines, restore volume in facial hollows and artistically facial contour, thereby creating an overall improvement of skin quality.

Whilst the ageing process is an inevitable part of life, dermal fillers can give you the confidence to hold your head up high, with minimal downtime and natural, subtle- looking results.

view prices faqs
Dermatology & Minor Surgery

We strive to combine convenience with traditional service, to ensure we provide personalised care plans for our patients.

Many of us have minor lumps and bumps that, whilst not medically worrying, can be annoying or unsightly. We offer a range of treatments including removal by excisions and cryotherapy.

Cryotherapy is a non-invasive skin treatment to remove unsightly moles, age spots, skin tags, milia and warts. This low risk procedure works by freezing the affected area to remove the blemish.

After your treatment, we recommend a follow-up visit after 2 to 4 weeks, to confirm that the treated lesions have disappeared.

We may arrange another follow-up treatment if necessary. Results may vary from person to person and some lesions may require surgical removal (excision).

view prices faqs
OBAGI Medical

With a 30-year legacy of science and innovation, Obagi has led transformative research that has met the needs of every skin tone and type. It aims to deliver extraordinary results by changing the way the skin functions at a cellular level to create a healthy skin for life.

Their mantra is to help your skin reach its full potential, be it for everyday use, or management of skin conditions. This is achieved through medicated and non- medicated skin care that is scientifically backed to promote healthy and future-facing skin.

To book your consultation or review, simply  call or email us and we will be more than happy to find you a suitable date and time.

ZO Skin Health

Dr. Obagi ‘the Inventor of Skin Health Science’ founded ‘ZO Skin Health’ in 2007. These skincare treatments provide innovative solutions to optimise skin health. It is based on the latest advances in skin technology and exclusive formulations, providing bespoke skin care for our patients.

Each treatment and regime is tailored to our patient’s needs, be it for everyday use or therapeutic management of skin conditions. This allows patients to experience continuously healthy skin regardless of their age, ethnicity or unique skin condition.

Products, protocols and treatments are provided by sk:INSPIRE, for a wide range of skin disorders and chronic conditions. Book a consultation to discuss the products and peels available.

To book your consultation or review, simply  call or email us and we will be more than happy to find you a suitable date and time.

AquaGold

AquaGold Fine Touch TM is a 24-carat gold medical facial system that delivers a bespoke blend of skincare. The new revolutionary micro-infusion delivery mechanism makes use of micro-needles to the dermis of the skin.

This truly customised facial treatment can be tailored to your needs with the use of vitamins, enzymes, plant extracts, and micro-quantities of botulinum toxin and hyaluronic acid-based dermal filler in order to improve texture, tone, and even firmness.

To book your consultation or review, simply  call or email us and we will be more than happy to find you a suitable date and time.

anti-wrinkle treatment

If you have any questions please call or email us.
What areas are treated?
  • - Forehead lines
  • - Crow's feet
  • - Brow lifts
  • - Gummy smile
  • - Chin dimpling
  • - Smokers' lines
  • - Nefertiti neck lift
  • - Hyperhidrosis (excessive sweating)
Am I suitable for treatment?

You will have a consultation with your practitioner who will assess your suitability and most importantly, tailor the treatment to ascertain your desired outcome. This treatment is suitable for men and women; however, men tend to require a slighter higher dose than women.

We will advise if wrinkle-smoothing injections is the best route to take or if another treatment is more appropriate.

Is the treatment safe and are there any side effects?

In the right hands, botulinum toxin is a very effective and safe treatment to cosmetically address facial wrinkles.

At sk:INSPIRE, risks will be discussed in depth at your consultation. Immediately following your treatment, the injection site can be mildly tender and swollen, which usually subsides after 48 hours.

Side effects are rare, but occasionally, you may experience heaviness over the eyebrows, which can last for 2 to 3 weeks. There is a very low risk (1-2%) of brow ptosis (drooping of the eyebrow) or eyelid ptosis (drooping of the eyelid), which completely reverses with time. Allergy, headaches, nausea and flu-like symptoms is extremely rare. There is a possibility that side effects lead to a requirement of further treatment lasting several months.

Treatments are provided at dedicated clinics by fully qualified medical practitioners who are able to deal with complications. The risks reduce in qualified hands – our aim is to keep you safe.

How long does the procedure take?

We allow 30 minutes for your appointment. The procedure itself takes from 5 to 10 minutes, dependent on the number of injection sites that are needed.

How long does it take to achieve results?

It can take up to 7 days to see the full effects following treatment. We offer our patients a complimentary follow-up appointment after 2 weeks where we review and administer a ‘top up’ if it is required.

The effects of the treatment can last up to 6 months but can vary between 3 to 4 months based on the individual. Our practitioners are highly trained and have carried out numerous treatments on a variety of patients with different skin types. We endeavour to create personalised treatment plans that will be successful.

Dermal Fillers

If you have any questions please call or email us.
How will I know if dermal fillers are for me?

You will have a consultation with your practitioner during which you will discuss if this treatment is suitable for your end goal. During the consultation, you can express your treatment needs and explore all your treatment options to ensure you get the best outcome. Following this session, you will be designed a bespoke treatment.

Are dermal fillers safe?

Facial dermal fillers have had a significant rise in their application for aesthetics and have been thoroughly tested to ensure its safe use. Risks of treatments will be discussed at your consultation.

How long does the treatment take?

Duration of treatment can vary for each patient and on the number of sites being treated. On average, the session should take no longer than 45 minutes, after which you will be given comprehensive aftercare. Following treatment, you will be able to drive, work and return to your daily activities.

How is the treatment carried out?

Your practitioner or nurse will initially apply a numbing cream to the area. This is left on the skin for up to 45 minutes to reduce discomfort during the treatment. The appropriate filler type will be chosen and delivered to the area of skin and/or lips to be treated in tiny amounts with a fine needle. The pre-discussed quantity of filler required may change during the procedure.

What are the side effects?

These will be discussed in depth during your initial consultation and most commonly consist of redness, swelling, bruising and minimal bleeding. Very rarely, lumps can occur as well as tissue damage. Our practitioners are highly trained to avoid such risks but if they were to occur, they are trained to deal with them.

What do I need to do for aftercare?

After your dermal filler treatment, we recommend the following.

  • - Do not apply make up for 12 hours
  • - Do not use any sauna or steam rooms
  • - Avoid any strenuous exercise
  • - Avoid sun exposure
  • - If you have had lip augmentation – do not drink anything too hot or cold.

We offer a complimentary review appointment 2 weeks after treatment, where additional filler can be administered, if required, at a discounted price. The procedure can be repeated according to personal choice with the aid of the practitioner.

How long will the effects last?

Results and duration of the effects of the treatment vary amongst individuals. The effects are non-permanent. They usually last between 6 months and 1 year but can be less or more depending on the area treated.

Your practitioner will discuss the effects in more depth at your initial consultation.

Dermatology & Minor Surgery

If you have any questions please call or email us.
What can we treat?

A whole range of skin conditions including:

  • - Rashes
  • - Eczema
  • - Acne
  • - Rosacea

As well as common lumps and bumps such as:

  • - Warts
  • - Veruccas
  • - Skin tags
  • - Actinic keratoses
  • - Seborrheic keratoses/warts
  • - Benign moles including mole checks

Our Clinicians can also manage:

  • - Lipomas
  • - Cyst
What will happen at my Initial Consultation?

You will be seen by your clinician who will review your skin condition/lesion and advise you on your treatment options. If it is a lesion that you would like to have removed, the risks will be discussed in depth.

We aim to offer certain treatments to be carried out during your consultation appointment itself, e.g. cryotherapy, for your time convenience, should you would wish to commence. Patients who require minor operation (e.g. surgical excision or biopsy) will be booked into our minor operation theatre suite under controlled conditions.

What are the risks of surgical removal (excision)?

There are a few side effects that may occur as a result of surgical removal of lesions, including the following:

  • - Infection
  • - Pain
  • - Bleeding
  • - Bruising
  • - Swelling
  • - Scar
  • - Return to theatres

We send all our lesions to the laboratory to confirm diagnosis. In rare cases, extension of the lesion may be seen on a microscope that cannot be seen with the naked eye, so may require another visit for a bigger area to be taken.

Does cryotherapy hurt?

You will feel a small sting which can last for a few minutes after the treatment. Occasionally, a blister may form and persist for a few hours.

Does it work on all skin tones?

Cryotherapy works on all skin tones. We recommend repeated treatment at 2-week intervals for patients with darker skin.

What are the risks of cryotherapy?

There are a few side effects that may occur as a result of cryotherapy treatment, including the following:

  • - Changes in pigment (hypopigmentation or hyperpigmentation).
  • - Nerve damage, particularly in areas such as the fingers, wrists and behind the ears.
  • - Minor fragments of ice may be expelled, that will thaw on contact with healthy skin.
  • - Hair follicle damage and permanent hair loss.
